title: Economic Toolkit | Anton Ebsen
description: My technical stack and tools for economic analysis and reproducible research.

hero.title: Economic Toolkit
hero.text: Detailed overview of the tools and libraries I use for econometric modeling, data engineering, and reproducible science.

items.title: Python (Core Stack)
items.desc: My primary environment. I use Pandas for data wrangling, NumPy for numerical computation, and Matplotlib/Seaborn/Plotly for visualization.

items.title: Econometric Libraries
items.desc: Experience with Statsmodels (regression, time series), Linearmodels (panel data), and Scikit-learn for predictive modeling.

items.title: Other Tools
items.desc: Solid experience with SQL for database extraction, as well as knowledge of R (Tidyverse) and SAS/Stata from academic projects.

items.title: LaTeX & Typography
items.desc: All my academic reports are written in LaTeX to ensure precise formatting of mathematical expressions and references.

items.title: Git & Version Control
items.desc: Using Git and GitHub to ensure full traceability in code and analysis. Experience with branching strategies and CI/CD.

items.title: Notebooks & Documentation
items.desc: Interactive Jupyter Notebooks for exploratory analysis and Quarto/Markdown for documentation.
